line.en: The scorching sun comes shining in.
Up on the roof, with nothing to block the\nsunlight, it feels even more like I'm being\nburned.
'Today is hot as hell...'
I grumble as I wipe the sweat from my brow.
It's already seven o'clock.
It's just before the peak of summer, and the sun\nis finally shining at full strength.
Today is Saturday, so there's no school.
Now is my chance to get some of the dorm mother\nwork done.
This morning, I've climbed up on the roof and I'm\nfixing leaks.
'This building is in pretty bad condition.'
I heard that the owner who collapsed a few days\nago, and who was also the caretaker here, is an\nelderly woman.
Because it was a girl's dormitory, with no guys\naround, there were quite a few places that had\nbeen left damaged.
This place is so old that I can't help wondering\nif originally, it was aiming to be registered as\na cultural heritage site.
The owner, who is a widow, opened the manor house\nas a student dormitory before I was born.
Which means that when we were calling this place\nthe 'Witch's Mansion', students from Keifuu\nAcademy were already living here.
Since then, the owner had been taking care of the\nboarding students like they were her own children\nor grandchildren.
However, since the redevelopment plans were\nbrought forward, land prices in Kazegaura have\nbeen rising.

The owner's sons were hoping to let go of this
place, which was one of the reasons why I was
brought on to take the dorm mother's job in such
a hurry.
It might be hard to avoid getting involved in\nthose kinds of adult matters, so I will just\nquietly get on with the work that I have to do.
'Alright, that should do it.'
Finishing the repairs to the roof, I climb down\nthe ladder.
'Ok, next is...'
'Quack quack!'
Hat, who was pecking at the soil, had come closer\nto where I was going to put my feet as I climbed\ndown.
This is kind of besides the point, but ducks eat\nweeds and bugs. So, it seems that if I just leave\nhim to it, he will maintain the garden.
However, he will also peck at the flowers and so\non too, so the person doing the gardening needs\nto watch out for that.
'What's up, Hat? Where's your buddy?'
'Quaaack!'
I have no idea what he's saying but he definitely\nlooks bored.
'Sorry but I've got work to do. When I get back,\nI'll give you a bath.'
'Quack...'
The door to Kotori's room was closed.
I couldn't hear any sound, and there were no\nsigns that she was awake.
'Still asleep, huh, sleepyhead?'
'Hey, Kotori!'
'Wake up, Allule!'
'Hey, Miss Allule!'
'Sh...shut up! What do you want!?'
'I'm going to do some shopping! Do you want to\ncome with me?'
'Huh? ...Is that the reason why you disturbed my\npeaceful sleep?'
'Her face seemed to say 'If this was America, and\nI sued you, you would lose!
'You're oversleeping. It's a nice sunny day, so\nlet's go outside.'
'Why do I have do your shopping with you...?'
'It's shopping for the dormitory. You eat too,\ndon't you?'
'...I'll get ready, so hold on a minute.'
'Hi there, hey...!'
'Tsk!'
Seeing Ageha give a great big wave, Kotori makes\nan annoyed face.
'Hi, Ageha!'
'Sup, Aoi! Morning, Kotori!'
'M...morning.'
'(Hey, why is she here!? You said we were going\nout to do shopping for the dormitory!)'
'(It's fine. There's something I need help\nwith.)'
I had planned from the beginning to meet up with\nAgeha.
That's because I want her as a special advisor\nfor today's work.
'Right, let's go.'
'Let's go! Let's go!'
'Unnh...'
We arrived at the underground street of the\nshopping mall.
There are many stylish shops in the shopping\narcade, and there is also a large supermarket.
I push Kotori along in her wheelchair and go\naround buying the food with Ageha.
'What do we need?'
'First, you need chicken thighs, then red\npeppers, green peppers, onions...'
Kotori looks like she still doesn't agree with\nthe fact that Ageha is with us.
She looks at me like she's trying to put a curse\non me.
'Ageha came to help come up with a menu for\ntonight's dinner.'
'It seems that the meals that I make don't appeal\nto the girls.'
'So... Why do I need to come with you?'
'Because you can... carry the bags?'
Kotori is doing a good job of carrying the green\nsupermarket basket.
Ageha and I keep slinging more and more\ningredients into the basket.
'Paprika powder, whole tomatoes, cured ham, then\nthere's...'
Fwip! Fwip!
'Don't sling them in like that!'
'I'll get some mineral water.'
BAM!
'Uh... It's so heavy.'
'Hey, hey, can I buy some potato chips?'
'No. Oh, Pakkuriman chips! I remember these!'
'You're so stingy. I'll pay for them later, so\nput them in the basket, will ya?'
She slings them in.
'Also, we'll soon be out of rice. Let's buy some\nwhile we're here.'
BAM!
'Ungh...'
With all of the ingredients for all of the\nboarders, before we knew it, the basket that\nKotori was carrying was full.
'D... don't treat me like a shopping cart!'
As she complained, Kotori was very careful not to\nlet the contents of the basket fall out.
'Don't drop anything.'
'Dammit!'
'Is there anything you want, Kotori?'
'Hmm... Ice cream.'
Today's shopping is being paid for with the\noperating costs of the dormitory, so we can't\nreally buy things we don't need.
Having said that, she is helping me out...
'You can get Bari-Bari-kun'
'Whaaaat! I want something of a higher quality\nthan that! The work I've put in and the reward I\nget aren't balanced!'
'...Have it your way.'
I decide to treat her to Strawberry Hargen Darch\nwith my own money.
'Is this one OK?'
'Hmmmm... yes, that's OK.'
We finish at the cash register.
The food costs about 50 percent more than usual.\nBut, tonight is a special occasion.
'Aw, geez. I forgot to buy ground meat.'
'Huh? But we don't need it.'
'It's for tomorrow. It's a pain to have to keep\ngoing to buy food all the time, you know?'
I leave them behind and go back to the store.
I search for the meat in the ground meat section.
'If I can, I wanna get one with a discount\nsticker. As I thought, there aren't any at this\ntime.'
The costs for the boarders food is paid on a\nmonthly basis.

The dormitory is run as kind of a hobby by the
owner, so it's just a rough estimate, but there
is an upper limit established as part of the rent
agreement.
The dormitory's meals follow the creed of 'as\ncheap as possible, as tasty as possible'.
I look at the packs of beef that are lined up on\nthe shelf.
'2980 yen for 100 grams...'
This is a supermarket that celebrity women come\nto, so sometimes the prices for the ingredients\nare pretty steep.
'It's OK once in a while, so I'd like everyone to\neat this kind of meat.'
I murmured to myself.
'Is this one OK, I wonder?'
Fwip!
A girl reaches across from the side, and slings\nthe luxury, marbled, 2980 yen for 100 grams meat\ninto her basket.
'...Will this be enough? We are having beef\ncurry, after all... hmm...'
The girl who took the pack showed signs of\nhesitation but continued to sling more and more\nof the luxury marbled meat into the basket.
In the end, she took everything that was on the\nshelf.
'That'll do it, alright!'
'Are you going to use luxury marbled beef in a\ncurry!!?'
Not only that, it's thinly sliced!
'Ah!'
I was supposed to have said that on the inside\nbut because of the shock, I came right out and\nsaid it aloud.
'I mean... If you're making curry, they have meat\nfor curry over here, see?'
'B...but when you eat curry, you don't see such\nbig pieces of meat, do you?'
'Well, when you stew meat this size, it becomes\nmore tender and much smaller.'
If you use that kind of thin meat, the fat will\nmelt away and you won't have a trace of it left.
'Huh? Huh?'
In her basket was about a kilogram of marbled\nmeat to be used in sukiyaki.
'(Are you going to stew all of that in a\ncurry...?)'
What a waste of good meat.
As I stare at the basket, she looks at me in\ndisbelief.
'...I'm so sorry!'
She seemed embarrassed as she said that and moved\nover to the fresh fish section.
Did I scare her off...?
'...Th... there's also seafood curry, so maybe I\nshould buy some fish too...?'

she said as I watch from a distance her throwing
sea bream, with the head and tail still on, into
the basket, while I reach for a pack of the cheap
pork and beef ground meat.
'Hee hee, it's delicious!'
'Kotori, you like Strawberry, do you? I like\nCookies and Cream.'
'Oh, really?'
'Is that tasty?'
'...Of course.'
'No.'
'I haven't said anything yet.'
'Yum, yum...'
'One spoonful! Just one spoonful!'
'No! There's only one spoon!'
'It's OK, we're both girls.'
'No' means 'No'!'
'Don't be so stingy!'
'Alright! Just one spoonful!'
'Yay, thanks Kotori!'
'Aaaaah...'
'Oh, my Hargen Darch...'
'Munch... It's delicious!'
'What are you doing?'
'Erk!'
I'd finished paying and had come back and Kotori\nwas letting Ageha eat her ice cream.
I felt like I'd seen something I wasn't supposed\nto see.
'It's... it's not what it looks like!' She said\nthat she really wanted to eat it, so I just let\nher have one spoonful!'
'I see. Well, it's nice that you two are getting\nalong.'
'No... no, it's not like that!'
'Hmm... Strawberry is nice too. Hey, hey, can I\nhave another spoonful?'
'No, that's all! There won't be any left for\nme...'
Blushing as she spoke, Kotori continued to wolf\ndown the Hargen Darch.
'OK, let's go. Here, take this bag.'
BAM!
'Huuuuh!?'
'Hey, this is... heavy!'
'I'll help too. To say 'thank you' for the ice\ncream!'
I push Kotori's wheelchair and we leave the\nshopping mall.
'...Hey, how do you cut this?'
'Pass that to me. I'll show you how it's done.'
'Her face seemed to say 'I get annoyed when\npeople get on their high horse' as she obediently\npassed me the knife.
In a way that Kotori could see easily, I cut the\nvegetables.
Chop chop chop.
'Like this.'
'How about this green pepper?'
'Wouldn't it be best to cut it in half down the\nmiddle?'
'OK, I'll try that.'
We had come back to the dormitory and had begun\ncooking in the dining hall.
I got Kotori, who couldn't reach the stove, to\ncut the vegetables.
I'm cooking, while Ageha helps and tells me how\nto do it.
'Hey, this is pretty easy.'
'See? You just cut the vegetables and stew them\nwith the chicken thighs.'
said Ageha, who had brought the recipe.
'Basque-style chicken stew'
I couldn't guess what kind of food it would be\nfrom just the name but it is really easy to make.
First, you grill the chicken thighs, then fry\nthem with the cut vegetables, and after that, add\nthe canned tomato and broth and leave it to stew.
It's a stew that doesn't need to be done\nprecisely.
That's the main dish, next we prepare the salad\nand the soup.
'Quack quaaack!'
Even as Hat walks around her feet, quacking,\nKotori doesn't seem to notice as she is quietly\nimmersed in what she's doing.
'(She's really concentrating.)'
'(Surprisingly, she's the enthusiastic type,\nisn't she?)'
Despite complaining at first, once she gets\nstarted, she becomes very serious.
'Whew... It's quite hard to cut them evenly.'
'Well, it doesn't need to be exact. If there's\nvariety in the thickness, it gives a difference\nin texture.'
'...Cut them unevenly? Got it.'
she said as she thought about this and that, and\nstarted intentionally cutting the vegetables\nunevenly.
I guess that's what people look like when they\nget serious.
'Ageha, how does this soup taste to you?'
'Hmm... the flavor is a little too mild.'
'I'll add salt and pepper.'
And so, the preparations for dinner continued\nsmoothly.
'Wow! It looks so tasty!'
One after another, the boarders came into the\ndining hall. They were surprised at how different\nthe food was to the usual
There is a general idea of meal times for the\nboarders.
Although I usually make meals on a consistent\nschedule, the time when everybody comes to eat is\nnot set.
It's OK if you come late, and it's OK if you\ndon't eat.
That's why, we often eat at different times.
This is the first time since I came here that\nwe've all gathered at the same time like this.
Today was the only time that I had told them in\nadvance.
'OK, everyone, please take a seat. You too,\nAgeha.'
'Heh heh, excuse me!'
'Today's dinner looks amazing...'
'Hey, can we start eating? I'm starving!'
'Go ahead, enjoy your meal.'
The boarders, looking at each other, cautiously\nmove the food towards their mouths.
'...It's delicious.'
'It really is delicious!!'
I can hear the word 'delicious' coming from the\nboarders.
'What is...? It's true, it really is tasty!'
'Basque-style chicken stew'
I was the one that had made it but I didn't know\nhow it would taste, and I imagined that it\nwouldn't be very good.

It was different to the western or Chinese food
that I usually make, in that I normally don't use
spices that make it easy to understand the
flavor.
The meat stewed in the tomato soup was tender,\nand was surprisingly refreshing.
Most importantly, the flavor of the meat had\nreally been drawn out, so I had no complaints at\nall about the taste.
It's the kind of thing that you eat on a hot\nsummer's day, when you don't have much of an\nappetite.
'This is great!'
'Please, have some salad too!'
The salad served in a big bowl was divided\nbetween everyone.
There were cucumbers, tomatoes and lettuce, and\nalso avocado and mozzarella cheese.
Even though it was just an elaborate salad,\nagain, the reaction was...
'This salad is delicious.'
'It's kind of fancy.'
Ryouko, a second-year like me, and Sanae, the\nthird-year with the trademark glasses, both\nseemed to really like it.
'Ha ha ha! This was 'produced' by me,\nAgeha-chan!'
Everyone made a face that kind of showed they\nknew that.
'The truth is that today's meal was made under\nthe advice of Miss Himegi here!'
'So that's why Ageha's here...'
'I thought I'd get him to make the food that I\nlike for me!'
By the way, it seems that Ageha and Ryouko were\nfriends from before.
'The thing is, it seems the food that I made\ndidn't really go down too well with everyone.'
Apart from Kanako, all of the boarders looked\naway for a moment, awkwardly.
'...It's not that it didn't taste good...'
'Yes, yes. But, the portions were very big...'
'Yeah...'
'That's why, if there's something you want to\nsay, please talk to me about it, OK?'
It's a little scary, but I thought I'd try to\ntalk them about it.
'How should I put this... It's all the same\ncolor.'
'Yes, I know what you mean! That's exactly it,\nYuka!'
'But today's food is... colorful.'
It sure is.
There's red, green, yellow and white and many\nother colors and looks vivid and colorful.
The food I usually make is:
Ginger pork = brown
Fried rice = brown
Curry = yellow
Yakisoba = brown
Neapolitan pasta = red
and so on, but it's all basically comprised of a\nsingle color.
'Aoi's food is hearty and I quite like it.'
'Yes, it's not that it doesn't taste good! But...\nyou see, recently, it's been really hot and we\ndon't have much of an appetite.'
'...So we get tired of it halfway through.'
Everyone's really kind aren't they?
They really care about my feelings.
'(Just because of that, I was unnecessarily\nworried...!)'
For a guy like me, who went to a sports-focused\nboys school, and lived together with his dad in a\nkind of bachelor pad, that was always enough.
I never even thought about the color of food.
Somehow, that kind of detail's really important\nin a girls' dormitory.
'But this is really delicious.'
'Can I have seconds?'
Everyone seems satisfied.
It feels like this is the most they've opened up\nto me so far.
'(If I'm going to say it, now's my chance!)'
'Umm... can I just say something?'
I stand up and get everyone's attention.
'Please listen as you eat.'
'This is about the boarders' chores. Would it be\nalright to increase them a little?'

'I'm a student too, so it's pretty tough for me.
For example, if I could just get you guys to
clean the bathroom, that would really be a big
help...'
Everyone looked at each other as if they were\ntrying to figure out what the others were\nthinking.
To be honest, no one's going to be happy about\nincreasing their chores.
But...
'OK, I understand.'
As Yuka, the oldest, responded, the others nodded\nin agreement.
'It must be tough for Aoi, you can tell that just\nby looking.'
'...The truth is, I was kind of worried about\nit.'
'He even fixed the leaky roof.'
'In return, I will try harder than ever to make\ngood food for you!'
'...We can eat this kind of delicious food every\nday!'
'Sounds good, doesn't it, Ryouko? I might live\nhere too!'
'Is that all we have to do?'
'That and one other thing.'
This is what I really wanted to say.
'I think that we should get Kotori to do some\nthings too.'

Kotori, who was sitting at the end of the table,
the furthest away from everyone, who looked
uncomfortable while she ate, was surprised to
hear her name called.
Everybody looked round at Kotori.
'But Kotori is...'
'She has a walking disability but she can use her\nhands. There are things that she can do.'
'Like today's dinner, she helped us with that.'
'...Yeah, only because you guys made me do it.'
This had a big impact on everyone, who until just\nnow had been eating the food and saying how\ndelicious it was.
They looked at her like they were impressed but\nKotori seemed kind of embarrassed.
'Thanks to Kotori helping us, we were able to get\nthe dinner preparations done easily.'
'If that's the case, then maybe we can add\nanother chore.'
I don't dislike cooking.
But to prepare food for several people is\nphysically quite demanding.
'If that's OK with Kotori. Could you help me\nprepare the meals?'
'Yeah, I guess. If that's what it's like.'
'Thank you.'
I say, while Kotori looks away and quietly nods,\nwithout saying anything.
'It's a little different than the other chores.\nBut, in order to be fair, I want Kotori to help\nout where she can from now on.'
Everyone still had their reservations about the\nwhole thing, so for now, they just quietly looked\nat each other.
Even so, until now, Kotori and the other boards\nhave had quite a distant relationship.
However, I'm the one who understands the\nsituation the least... or rather, the one who\nunderstands it the most.
'Excuse me!'
Kanako raised her hand, then the others followed.
'If she can do that, it would be really good.'
'I think so too, Yuka!'
'...I always thought it was a little strange.'
'So, from tomorrow, let's do our best.'
'You too, dorm mother.'
'You too, Kotori!'

Kotori was moody until the end. But, she kept
herself from shouting abuse at me, which I know
she's good at. She seemed to understand my
intentions.
'Thanks for today, Ageha. You really helped me\nout.'
'Don't mention it. When you're in trouble, I'll\ncome to your rescue. That's how it always is,\nright?'
'Same goes for you too.'
'Quack!'
Hat came waddling from down the corridor.
'Oh, Mr. Duck. What's up? Have you come to see me\noff?'
'Quack!'
Hat flapped his wing towards Ageha.
'Maybe he's saying thanks for helping Kotori.\nThose are his feelings as her housemate.'
'OK, tell her this when you go back to her room:\n'I had fun today.''
'Quaaaack!'
The way he replied made it seem like he\ncompletely understood what Ageha had said, and\nHat wiggled his tail as he waddled off.
'Hmmmm... He's so cute.'
'OK, take care on your way back.'
'Sure, see you later.'
'Quack quack'
'Hat, where did you go? OK, here's a cucumber\nsnack.'
'Quack!'
'Hey, listen Hat. Today, I helped make dinner.'
'It was something-or-other style chicken stew.\nEveryone said it was delicious.'
'I ate it too. It really was delicious.'
'Isn't that great?'
'Quack! Quack!'
'Hee hee!'
'...Today will soon be over.'
'...But it was fun.'
